intro: Nonea palmyrensis, commonly known as the Palmyrene nonea, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Nonea palmyrensis is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
